results.title: Timeless treasure
results.brief_description: Deals with the continual deterioration and destruction of man’s cultural heritage and the need for active preservation. Shows rebuilding and restoration work, and discusses the role of UNESCO’s International Study Centre for the Restoration and Preservation of Cultural Property in organising and assisting such undertakings as safe-guarding the temples threatened by the Aswan Dam in the Nubian Valley

results.title: Timeless Temiar
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Zain Hussain
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the Aborigines of the Temiar tribe of Northern Perak, Malaya. They lead a civilised life when left in their own environment and make full use of jungle resources.

results.title: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl ...
results.creator_credit: International Video Books and Gerben Cath
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “The Musicians of Bremen”, “The Writing on the wall”, “Did you ever?”, “Chanticleer”, “Mr. and Mrs. Hay the horse”, “Mabel’s story”, “The Witch and the owl”, “Funnybones” and “Jorinda and Joringel”.

results.title: Time: measurement and meaning
results.brief_description: How does time move, what is “now”, what is reverse, or “backward” time? This account of modern theoretical and practical physical science examines concepts of time dilation, the entropy principle and astronomical time, relation of subjective and external time and the definition of a second. Scientific timepieces are shown, such as an atomic clock and a waterclock, as well as a brief glimpse of a cyclotron.

results.title: Time, space and effort
results.creator_credit: Editorial Film Productions, James Mellor and Jack Chambers
results.brief_description: The importance of the fork-lift truck and the unit land system of materials handling at various stages of industrial production and distribution are described. The movement of unit loads on pallets by road and rail from factory to warehouse is illustrated in detail. Many types of fork-lift trucks are shown at work, some fitted with ancillary attachments designed for handling particular materials. The savings made possible in time and storage space are shown in ‘before’ and ‘after’ examples of working methods.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Editorial Film Productions, James Mellor and Jack Chambers

results.title: Time, lines and events. - [Revised]
results.brief_description:
After explaining the use and making of timelines, the film brings on an imaginary Time Machine Camera which can travel down a vertical timeline into the deep past. On command, the camera shows how the earth looked at any particular time. It searches for the beginnings of life, the presence of dinosaurs, for cave people, and the pyramids. The film dramatises the relative briefness of the history of the United States, and of human beings, and concludes by showing how all the events of history give us our sense of time itself.
Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Time Zones
results.creator_credit: Dark Pictures, James MacKay and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description: Sloane Square: A Room of One’s Own (1976, 9min); This super 8 footage shot in 1976 features Jarman and friends and is an example of his more personal, quasi-diary work. “Pirate Tape” (1982, 15 min); A portrait of William Burroughs, filmed during his visit to London in September 1982 for the Final Academy event. “TG Psychic Rally in Heaven” Film of “Throbbing Gristle” in concert, on 23/12/80, accompanied by three tracks from their “2nd Annual Report” album. Experiments with super-imposition and refilming abstract the performance into coloured patterns, drawing attention to the sound track content.

results.title: Time to think
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Short Films Group, Anthony Pelissier and Peter Hammond
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Manager in Action”
A dramatised version of daily office routines showing how a manager can delegate tasks to other staff leaving major considerations to be dealt with more thoroughly.
